p: Barbosa et al. [ 41] identified 35 different constituents in copaiba oil extracted from Copaifera multijuga, with a high predominance of sesquiterpenes (88.55 to 98.05%). Herrero-Jáuregui et al. [ 42] reported that, among the identified sesquiterpenes, the predominant ones in the Copaifera reticulada D. oil were β-caryophyllene, trans-α-bergamotene, and β-bisabolene. Emerenciano et al. [ 43] reported that the copaiba oil obtained from Copaifera multijuga H. presented 73.1% sesquiterpenes, 16.9% diterpenes, and 10.5% fatty acids in its composition.
